DOC.detailed_description: All eligible patient willing provide write informed consent invite participate study , randomize 1:2 either Control Group Echo-guided Group . Patients randomize Control Group implant dual chamber pacemaker ( DDDR ) device ( St. Jude Medical ) standard therapy . Patients randomize Echo-guided Group implant cardiac resynchronization therapy pacemaker ( CRT-P ) device ( St. Jude Medical ) , program DDDR pace mode ( CRT-P OFF ) implant . For Echo-guided Group patient , presence RVA pacing induce ventricular dyssynchrony assess within 24-hour implant use standardized criterion Doppler echocardiography . The Echocardiography Core Laboratory ( Echo Core Lab ) analyze image treatment allocation Echo-guided Group do within 72-hour post implant base Echo Core Lab outcome : - Patients presence RVA pacing induce ventricular dyssynchrony allocate CRT-P standard therapy CRT-P turn ON - Patients absence RVA pacing induce ventricular dyssynchrony allocate DDDR standard therapy CRT-P remain OFF Patients meet inclusion criterion meet exclusion criterion eligible study . Data collect follow study visit : Enrollment , Implant & Randomization , Pre-discharge ( PDH ) ( ≤ 72 hour post implant ) , Month 1 follow-up visit : 30 ± 14 day post implant , Month 3 follow-up visit : 90 ± 14 day post implant , Month 6 follow-up visit : 180 ± 14 day post implant Month 12 follow-up visit : 365 ± 14 day post implant
